page.title: 09FARMING..CAIRNIE FARM
page.content: Cairnie farm lies north of Cupar and has been in the Laird family since 1969. Originally the land was all part of the Ancient Barony of Pitbladdo, but around the last centary the land was sold. Cairnie itself wasn't originally intended to be a working farm, it was owned by a family of professional soldiers, headed by General Fowlis, who bought the surrounding 118 acres for his family and wife to live in while he fought in the Napoleonic Wars. The farm lies in the Parish of Cupar and thus the Laird family should have reserved pews in the Parish church. The Cupar Parish boundary stretches to the Moonzie Burn which crosses the south of this area.
